result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian R. French was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian R. French is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian R. French was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Brian R. French was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft during his probation sentence.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Angela Komp.  Court contacted Agent Kali Morgan to inquire about a dispute made by deft.  Sentencing arguments made.

Count 1 - deft sentenced to 4yrs WSP; initial confinement of 30mos followed by 18mos of ES.  See conditions.  Deft not eligible for CIP or ERP.  Credit for 95 days. 

Count 3 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for 6mos consecutive to count 1.  Probation conditions to be identical to those of ES.  

Appeal rights.
DNA ordered

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Angela Komp.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to counts 1 & 3; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 10/5/15 @ 2pm.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Atty A. Komp with defendant, in custody.   Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found.
